message: I guess it depends on ones interpretation of common sense. in my estimation, common sense would require sufficient specific information of particular relevance as a foundation for the formulation of an opinion or belief. there are many types of proceedings which are best performed in circumstances where those involved and the subject matter remain confidential until certain resolutions are established, jury deliberations for example. this doesn't necessarily indicate that the proceedings are not in the peoples best interest. perhaps we should consider whether there are good reasons, that we are not aware of or do not comprehend as yet, (as we may not be experienced trade negotiators) that might require that initial negotiations remain confidential.
